alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Johnson; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 4:23PM EDT until May 06 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in northeast Kentucky, Johnson and Martin. In southeast Kentucky, Floyd and Pike. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 422 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pikeville, Paintsville, Prestonsburg, Inez, Coal Run Village, Elkhorn City, Martin, Forest Hills, Warfield, Allen, Gulnare, McCombs, Heenan, Jarad, Piso, Moree, Coal Run, Meta, Endicott and Varney. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
